title: Analysis of MOOC Learning Engagement Patterns and Design Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with online learning, and understanding of basic math concepts
context.additional_context: A smartphone-based learning environment with formative assessment-centered asynchronous education

learning_goals: Learners can classify MOOC participation patterns into three types using educational process mining techniques.
Learners can suggest improvements to instructional design considering learning activity types (e.g., video viewing, quizzes, discussions) and temporal sequencing.
Learners can develop customized learning strategies by analyzing key engagement pathways for learner clusters.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
